intro: Lappula cenchroides, commonly known as narrowleaf lappula, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Papaveraceae, which includes poppies and other flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, yellowish flowers that bloom in late summer. Its leaves are narrow and lance-shaped, often with hairy surfaces. Lappula cenchroides is typically found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
